com.microsoft.cognitiveservices.speechrecognition

Class DataRecognitionClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.bing.speech.Conversation
      • com.microsoft.cognitiveservices.speechrecognition.DataRecognitionClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataRecognitionClientWithIntent

    public class DataRecognitionClient
extends Conversation
    Use the AzureIntelligentServices to do speech recognition with data (for example from a file or audio source). The data is broken up into buffers and each buffer is sent to the Speech Recognition Service. No modification is done to the buffers, so the user can apply their Silence Detection. Returns only text recognition results.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      void endAudio()
      Notify the server that client is done sending audio buffers to the Speech Recognition Service.

      Send buffers of audio to the Speech Recognition Service.
      void sendAudioFormat(SpeechAudioFormat audioFormat)
      If you are not sending up a audio file in wave format, and instead you have just raw data, then before sending up any audio data, you must first send up an SpeechAudioFormat descriptor to describe the layout and format of your raw audio data.

      • Methods inherited from class com.microsoft.bing.speech.Conversation

        audioStart, audioStop, PlayWaveFile, StreamTTS, TTSStop

    • Method Detail

      • sendAudioFormat

        public void sendAudioFormat(SpeechAudioFormat audioFormat)
        If you are not sending up a audio file in wave format, and instead you have just raw data, then before sending up any audio data, you must first send up an SpeechAudioFormat descriptor to describe the layout and format of your raw audio data.
        Parameters:
        audioFormat - Audio features that describe the encoding and sampling rate of the audio.

      • sendAudio

        public void sendAudio(byte[] buffer,
             int actualAudioBytesInBuffer)
        Send buffers of audio to the Speech Recognition Service. This work is queued onto a background worker.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The data bytes of audio to send to the Server
        actualAudioBytesInBuffer - The buffer size is allowed to be larger than the actual audio data in the buffer, so this parameter states the size of the actual data in the buffer.

      • endAudio

        public void endAudio()
        Notify the server that client is done sending audio buffers to the Speech Recognition Service. This work is queued onto a background worker.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Should only be called when client is ready to break the connection with the Speech Recognition Server. For example, after the Speech Recognition Server returns the final speech recognition result.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Conversation
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
